thread.title: HS football: Newton South braces for Westford
thread.title_full: HS football: Newton South braces for Westford | Boston Herald

author: Dan Ventura , Week 6 Football Preview
title: HS football: Newton South braces for Westford
text:
There is a special buzz in the air at Newton South this week.
The football team is undefeated and the school is bringing in portable lights for tonight’s showdown with Westford Academy for first place in the Dual County Large.
No one could be happier for the kids than Lions coach Ted Dalicandro, who has seen the struggles the program has gone through in recent years and has a greater appreciation for the steady improvement.
“The kids are very excited. They’ve worked very hard in the offseason to get here,” Dalicandro said. “It’s a great feeling to be able to play a Friday night game at home. I think there’s something special about playing on a Friday night, more kids come to the game. It’s just better.”
Fans will see one of the more high-powered attacks around. Newton South (5-0) is averaging more than 33 points with quarterback Austin Burton leading the way. He has a stable of receivers led by Anthony DeNitto, Sasha Hoban and Frankie Barros, while running back Jamyre Soberanis is more than capable of keeping defenses honest.
Westford Academy (4-0) rallied in the second half a week ago to defeat Waltham, 21-10, scoring the final 21 points. Connor Degenhardt is one of the top-ranked quarterbacks around and one of the big reasons why the Grey Ghosts have won seven straight dating back to last year. Running back Ben Cassidy and wide receiver Nick Fiorillo are the top skill position players. Linebacker Nick Diamond anchors a defense which has not allowed more than 14 points in a game.
“I don’t think we need to play a perfect game to win,” said Westford coach Adam Gagne. “We just need to play a complete game, just have that next play mentality.”
In other key contests tonight, Central Catholic can clinch the MVC Large with a win at Andover , while Billerica can seal the deal in the MVC Small by prevailing at Haverhill . A pair of top 10 teams will do battle in Dorchester as BC High hosts St. John’s Prep . Ashland will hit the road to attempt to defeat Millis-Hopedale , while Cardinal Spellman hosts St. Mary’ s.
The best nonleague game of the weekend pits a pair of undefeated teams as Dighton-Rehoboth travels to East Bridgewater . Wellesley will look to remain undefeated tomorrow when it hosts Norwood . First place in the Mayflower Small is on the line when West Bridgewater visits Nantucket . The two best games in the ISL are BB &N at Milton Academy and St. Sebastian’s at Lawrence Academy .
